name: treatment of wastewater from lorry production, wastewater treatment, urban | wastewater from lorry production | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/26788/documentation

This dataset represents the treatment of a wastewater, generated from an ordinary transforming activity. Purification in wastewater treatment of 'wastewater from lorry production'. Recommended use of this dataset: to be used for wastewaters, generated from ordinary transforming activities, of equal or similar composition. The wastewater has a content of TOC: 0 kg/m3, COD: 0 kg/m3 and BOD: 0 kg/m3. TOC is equal to C present in the wastewater, COD is calculated as TOC/0.2565 and BOD is calculated as COD/0.53034. Detailed elemental composition can be found in the properties of the wastewater treated. Share of biogenic carbon in the sludge: 0%.

The activity starts with the wastewater being available at the gate of the treatment facility. Collection and transportation of the wastewater to the treatment plant is not included.

The activity ends with the wastewater being treated and waste-specific emissions released to the environment. Expenditures from treatment of wastewater in waste treatment plant are included as well as relevant infrastructure of the plant. Emissions from any sludge digestion, biogas generation and utilization (heeding specific wastewater composition) are also included. Waste-specific direct emissions of untreated wastewater and required territory-specific infrastructure for sewers are not contained within this dataset but instead in the regional market datasets for this wastewater.
category: E:Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities/37:Sewerage/370:Sewerage/3700:Sewerage

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The site has mean annual temperature (MAT) of 9.5 degC, mean annual precipitation (MAP) of 1483.00559816076 mm/year, mean annual actual evaporation (EAT) of 528.63778611689 mm/year. In the WWT plant, 0% of its water input are lost due to evaporation from pools, 0% of water is *gained* from organic mass degradation, and 0.000168% is removed off site via sludge disposal. (References: UN data, 2020. Precipitation, Environment Statistics Database, United Nations Statistics Division Available at: http://data.un.org/Data.aspx?q=precipitation&d=ENV&f=variableID%3a6; World Bank, 2022. Surface area (sq.km), World Bank Group Available at: https://data.worldbank.org/indicator/AG.SRF.TOTL.K2; MeteoSwiss, 2022. Data on Swiss temperature mean, Federal Department of Home Affairs FDHA. Federal Office of Meteorology and Climatology. Swiss Climate Available at: https://www.MeteoSwiss.admin.ch/home/climate/swiss-climate-in-detail/Swiss-temperature-mean/Data-on-the-Swiss-temperature-mean.html?query=TEMPERATURE+DATA&topic=/content/MeteoSwiss/tags/topics/klima&pageIndex=0&tab=search_tab; Doka G.,2021. A model for composition-specific life cycle inventories of regionalised wastewater fates, Zurich, Switzerland. http://www.doka.ch/publications.htm)
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: This activity represents the treatment of a specific wastewater in a WWT plant (while direct emissions and sewering are heeded in the upstream market dataset for this wastewater). The size of the treatment plant infrastructure is for a national average territory situation. The assumed size of the WWTP treats 90.6 Mio m3 per year. The mixture of WWTP with one, two, or three stages is 0%-11.2%-88.8%. The actual, waste-specific oxygen requirement in the biological stages is 0kg O. Generated waste-specific raw sludge is treated with anaerobic digestion. The digestion process produces 0.0117 litres of biogas with an energy content of 0.0002165MJ. 23.6% of the biogas is utilized for energy. The remainder is flared. The gross electric efficiency is 26.564%. The gross thermal efficiency is 47.853%. After digestion, the remaining total sludge mass (dry matter) is 0.0008944kg DM.
